If you are a Repeater, you can do it. But if you are a Fresher you can't crack NEET in 1 month. Here's how to crack NEET in 1 Month for Repeaters:— I hope you are Good in Biology (as many Repeaters are). So you can revise Bio in maximum 10 days if you studied for 16 hrs per day with full concentration. Since your Bio is strong so don't waste much time in Bio.As being a Repeater, you might be Average in Chemistry, so take 1 week for Chemistry. There are total approx 30 chapters in Chemistry. You don't need to prepare all. Just choose 22–25 important Chapters and prepare these within 1 week with question practice. I think if you are a Repeater, 1 week is Enough to prepare 22 chapters.Now you have 14 days left. Remaining Subject is Physics. As we all know, almost all NEET aspirants are weak in Physics. But don't worry. Just prepare 10 most important Chapters in just 5 days with full concentration and Practice these while preparing. I think Modern Physics, Electrostatic, Optics and Kinematics will be good choice. As these Chapters are Important and Easy to prepare.Now 9 days are left. It's Enough for your Revision. Utilize these 9 days very carefully because Revision is most Important.For Revision, divide Topics on the basis of your Weakness. Focus more on Weak Topics. Solve MCQs as much as you can. Try to revise all the Tough & Confusing Topics more.6. Make lists of important formulas and important numerical values. 7. Prefer NCERT only for Biology and Chemistry. For Physics, use your Coaching modules and Notes copy. If you will follow the steps which I have given you, I swear no one can stop you from cracking NEET. On following my strategy, you will make 70–75 Questions in Bio + 30–35 Questions in Chemistry and approx 10 Questions in Physics. This means total 110 to 120 questions which is enough for your Selection. Just be careful about Time Management. Don't waste Time. You need to study 16 hrs per day. I hope this helps you! Good Luck.

For the last 40 days before neet you should mainly focus on doing a lot of mcq's. You should solve only mcq’s at this point of time as the time has come when you put your knowledge to test. Then analyse which are the topics you are not able to answer from. Read those topics thoroughly again. Then again solve those questions that you were not able to answer. Write the topics from which you make most of the mistakes and keep revising them. It will not only strengthen your topics but also make a check list prepared for yourself about the topics you have to see before going to exam. Also make a short notebook in which you write all the formulas of physics for quick revision. By doing so , you will not have to go through the entire chapter again and again and it will save your time for solving mcq's. Join a test series and don't miss a single test from it. Analyse your mistakes after every test so that you don't repeat them again. 2 weeks before the exam, you should take full syllabus mock tests. It will prepare you completely for the 3 hrs game and try to complete atleast 3 such tests in a day. These are some of the important chapters from biology that you should focus on- Living world Ecology Cell biology Genetics Plant kingdom Reproduction in plants as well as animals Biomolecules Biotechnology Human physiology For biology mainly focus on NCERT now For physics try solving as many numerical problem as possible. For chemistry focus on both theory and numerical. Since 50% paper comes from biology , so try to make your biology strong. All the best

Trust me even if u don't get selected u will still feel satisfied remembering the hard work of that 1 month. So all the best!

The countdown begins for the end game. The Marvel series of Avenger is going to be run all for 3 hours and 2 minutes. Aren’t you waiting eagerly to know what is kept in store in the grand finale season of Game of Thrones?  April is all packed with Thrones and Superheroes. Herein, concentrating on studies is quite a task in itself. Should I watch my favorite show or prepare for NEET-UG which is 8 days after the release of Avengers? And by the time you get your time out of this, you get the shock of your life about your pending NEET examination. So, before beginning the tricks and tips, the first tip is get away from all the social media accounts like Instagram, Facebook, and WhatsApp, (they are powerful to lure you into watching the game of thrones or go for the Marvel end game) But, do ensure your parents don’t cut off the entire internet connection. Because the internet can be useful for other reasons too like for watching NEET online videos and preparation strategies on YouTube and other education apps! So, keeping aside the thought of Avengers and Game of Thrones for a while (for a month per se), let’s get to the hot seat of NEET exam and look out on some tricks which can strengthen your chances of cracking the examination within a months’ time. If you are already studying since some time and worried about what to do in the remaining one month then all you can do is PRACTICE and PRACTICE! However, if you belong to the few who are yet, to begin the study (I hope you are not) then here is a quick crash mantra for cracking NEET 2019. Note: You can crack it only on following your timetable with perseverance without wavering. Day 1 - Spend your first day going through the entire syllabus, and the important topics. List down the topics you are weak at and those which are your strengths. As you have only a month left, going on snail speed can’t be the solution. So perk up and do a good cross-check of each topic. Day 2 to Day 20 From day 2 start your preparation on each topic which you are weak at and go on making notes as you are studying. Amidst this do not forget to revise the topics or chapters that you find easy. Leaving them without revising on the pretext that they can be covered later will only complicate things. So, from here on for continuous 15 to 20 days just do PRACTICE. Read the chapter – Make notes – revise previously completed chapters and PRACTICE. Repeat! Refer to online videos and notes Firstly, due to the paucity of time, referring to a myriad of books is unlikely to happen. And thus, zero in on those books that offer precise and concise information. If the book comprises of test series and previous year papers it's much better. Additionally, you can also refer to videos online as watching them can make it much easier in understanding the concepts. Make Cheat notes Okay, so herein 'Cheat Notes' doesn't mean you are to cheat. But making cheat notes wherein you can jot down the important formulae or concepts in language that you can understand is much better. Thus, later during revision you can just pick the note and read through it instead of reading the whole chapter. Refer to previous year papers If there is no way for hard work, it's better to opt for smart work. By smart work, we speak of referring to previous year papers. Past year question papers render a better understanding of which questions and topics were asked frequently. Through this, you can concentrate only on those chapters which carry more weightage based on the previous year question papers and save your precious time. Stay Calm and DO NOT PANIC! All this while, remember not to stress or panic. A calm mind will aid in retaining what you have studied in a much better manner. As necessary is covering the exam, equally important is keeping one’s mind healthy. So sleep well, eat healthily and indulge in some physical exercise like Yoga, Meditation, etc. Count Down – Last 10 days left! Now that the last 10 days are left, stop starting with newer chapters and concentrate revising the topics which you have already covered. Practice them, again and again, to build your strength in the subject. 1 day before the exam! Just chill and do not touch your books. This will only raise the panic level making you forget what you have already learned. So a day before the exam, keep your book aside, listen to songs or watch a movie. But do not touch your book. Go to the exam with a relaxed and calm mind. If your exam goes well, you can anytime go back and watch Avengers End Game with peace without the fear of ending your NEET-UG test in repentance. All the Best!

NEET 2018 Last Minute Tips:- 1. Revision is Must:-concentrate on revising the notes that you have prepared at the time of preparation. 2. Proper Rest and Relaxation You might be a hard-worker and smart learner, but it’s a fact that without having proper rest and relaxation, you won’t be able to grasp the perfect essence of what you have read. 3. Health is Important The experts suggest that when you are about to appear for any exam, you must be healthy, both mentally and physically. For being healthy, you must take healthy diet and exercise daily. Don’t skip your food while you study during the last days of preparation. Without having a proper diet, you may feel sleepy and tired. 4. Practice Daily One of the most important NEET last minutes tips is to practice a lot on daily basis. Practicing papers and various sets of mock tests can improve your level of confidence and also help you in taking the test in the actual feel of the D-Day. 5. Concentrate on Important Formulas The research shows that focusing on the important formula in the remaining days of exam is one of the most followed NEET last minute revision tips among the toppers of National Eligibility cum Entrance Test. The reason is that the questions which are based on the formulas or facts have more marking weightage than others. So, revising the formulas can help you increase your score in neet 6. Focus on Diagrams and Graphs As per the Expert’s suggested NEET 2018 last minute tips, candidates are advised to study with the help of diagrams and graphs while revising. With the help of diagrams & graphs, you can revise the points within a very short duration. 7. Don’t Start Any New Topic The last few days of exam is not the correct time to study new topics, so you should avoid getting engaged in learning them. If you continue preparing a new one, it will create confusion and your stress level will also be increased, which can affect you badly in the exam. 8. Make Your Strong Sections Stronger While preparing for the exam, you can find some topics over which you have good command. So, the last minute suggestion for NEET 2018 is that you must make those topics stronger. You should not take the concepts which create confusion and are very tough or tricky. Strengthening your strong subject areas will help you in getting good scores. 9. Clear Your Queries In the last days, while studying if you face any doubt or query regarding any of the subjects, you must consult and clear your doubts with your teachers or friends, who have proper knowledge of the respective subject. Getting all your doubts cleared is one of the important NEET last minute tips because before entering the exam hall, you must not have any confusion left in your mind. 10. Work on Your Speed and Accuracy Your speed and accuracy play a very important role while attempting the Paper. As per the neet pattern , you will get 180 questions. Out of these, you must attempt the maximum number of questions in the provided time limit of 180 minutes. But the attempts that you make must be accurate. If you use guesswork and mark wrong answers, you have to pay by the means of negative marking of ‘-1’ for each wrong attempt. Therefore, when you practice previous papers or mocks test series, you must set a time limit for solving them. Make sure, you must go for accurate attempts. 11.Relax, Be Calm and Stay Healthy Always keep calm and relax, this is very important as most of the students tend to worry at last minute. Remember you are human not a machine. You should listen to songs, practice yoga and take breaks. Take proper meal and avoid street food. Upvote and do follow me for more such content Thank you.

The National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET) is a 3 hours duration medical entrance exam. Nailing the NEET exam is the dream of every medical field’s aspirant. Cracking it opens the doorways to the top-ranked and the most prestigious medical institutes of India. Yes, you can prepare for NEET in one month. You just need to make a proper strategy and follow it with dedication. This is the most crucial time of your preparation time. This is the time when you can self-evaluate yourself and work on your weaker sections. First of all, make a separate schedule for the month and add meditation to your routine because it will help you very much with your health, as many students go into depression due to lousy schedule and ill health. Further, go through previous year question papers to get to know about the type of questions usually asked in NEET. I’d also recommend you to: 1. Work on weaker areas; don’t let them get the better off of you. 2. Practice as many mock tests as you can, but take breaks in between because we don’t want you snoring off between the exam. 3. Stay positive and confident. 4. Take proper and weather-appropriate diets; stay healthy. 5. Don’t indulge in guesswork at all; it’ll harm you more in reality than it will do an imaginary good. 6. Get all your doubts cleared before the exam. Toppr has a 24x7 doubts on chat facility that could help you.

There are two ways to take this: 1st are you going to start afresh- i.e you have not studied for past 2 years or you just talking about revision and brushing in the next few days. For the 1st part frankly speaking, its very easy to clear NEET Entrance exam. Cracking NEET 2018 means you are talking bout mere qualifying NEET 2018, which I would suggest you is not a big thing. Because if you see that NEET 2017 qualifying marks at 50 percentile you will find that you require only 131 Marks out of 720. So I can tell you for sure you will be able to qualify NEET 2018.  For the 2nd part we are talking of revision: 1st start by giving mocks and after that analyse you paper properly, get to know exactly what is your weak area and which are your strength. Than start revising your strong area and give extra time to the subjects or topics you are not comfortable at. 2nd in a week try and give 3–4 mocks, and give it as if you are writing actual NEET Paper. with the same 3 hour duration and start giving full fledged test. 3rd please do not give mocks only of ALLEN but take other coaching institute mocks also which will give you more holistic approach and let you now exactly where you going wrong. 4th, Start getting confident and do not get disheartened because end of the day those 3 hours will matter on your D DAY. But yes qualifying in NEET will not be an issue for you what is more important is the kind of college you are looking forward for in NEET. Are you just planning to just qualify or at the same time looking forward for a top colleges in INDIA. Because its just not about getting a medical seat but a lot about whether you are looking for Government Medical Colleges, Private Medical college or Deemed University. What do you mean by crack NEET in a month? If it is qualifying in NEET then yes it is possible with one month’s preparation. Since you need about 150 marks out of 720 to qualify. All you need to do is score enough to be in the top 5 lakh or so students out of the 10 lakh who write the exam. If you want to be in the top 5000 ranks in the country then it is more difficult unless you have studied exceedingly well for the board exams. Revised at least 10 times for each subject and understood all concepts and know your bio and chem like the back of your hand and now you have to concentrate on solving thousands of mcqs before the exam. solve previous year papers and so on. You get a rank in top 5000 if you have scored 518 or above out of 720. If you want to get a seat in top 3000 of your state also the same rule as the above applies. You need to score around 480 to 500 probably. depends on the level of competition in your state.

A lot has been written on how to succeed in NEET-UG exams. You just need to type NEET in search engines and there will be hundreds of articles out there suggesting so many tips on how to clear NEET exams. Some articles will even tell you how to prepare for NEET in last 40 days and some will say let’s rock the NEET exam in last 1 month. Kind of a magic. But the fact is, NEET is secret which is solved by many hardworking students every year. And, with every passing year new experiences are been shared towards more efficient preparation of NEET. Students really have to understand that SUCCESS in NEET is not an overnight story. It’s a 2 years long journey which starts from 11th standard itself. It’s a dream which is seen from childhood. Don’t just make this dream a joke. It’s a roller coaster journey of emotions, hard-work, expectations, fears and courage. Fears of not doing well and courage of overcoming those fears. The happiness that one aspirant gets after clearing entrance exam, only he can know it. Others can just estimate the level of satisfaction. Be serious from first day itself. Don’t think what could happen in 1 year, 1 month or 1 day. Follow NCERT as your standard textbooks. Refer to as minimum books as possible. Different book have different answers and concepts. Continue with your preparation and be confident. Thank you!

First, don’t get demotivated you should be self motivated if you really want to crack this exam. You should go through the chapters which carries more weightage in the exam. NEET 2017 Important Chapters Of Physics Scope and excitement of physics, physics measurement and world, physical law and technology, physics, society, units and needs of measurement, SI and fundamental units, length measurement, mass measurement, time measurement, measurement errors, accuracy instruments, important of figures, physical dimensional and quantities NEET 2017 Important Chapters Of Chemistry Basic information about the chemistry, chemistry scope and important, chemical combination law, abstraction of atoms, molecules and elements, molecules and atom masses, mole description, molar masses, percentage of composition and formula for the molecular, chemical compositions and reactions, stoichiometry and their calculations NEET 2017 Important Chapters Of Biology You have to cover both the zoology and biology subject. Diversity and biodiversity, classification needs, three types of domain life, systematic and taxonomy, information about the species, taxonomy, binomial theory, tools and types of taxonomy- zoos, botanical garden, herbaria, Museums, five types of kingdom classification, mineral classification and its features, fungi and Protista. One Month Preparation Strategy for Cracking NEET Phase 2017 Prepare a Preparation Schedule: As discussed above, aspirants must follow a strict preparation schedule owing to the scarcity of time. You must assign a fixed amount of time to a fixed number of chapters and complete the chapters as per the designed schedule. Review & Solve Previous Years’ Papers: This is the best way to boost up your preparation owing to the scarcity of time. You must study and solve 10 previous years’ papers of AIPMT. This will help you get acquainted with the pattern of questions asked and the difficulty level of questions asked in NEET exam. Study the Right Material: You must refer to NCERT books for all the three subjects. You must also refer to additional comprehensive books for practising MCQs. Build Your Concepts : You must develop a strong base in all the three subjects and must clear your concepts. This would greatly help you in solving conceptual questions. Practice: You must practice a mixed bag of MCQs from different comprehensive books and from different Internet sources. Focus On Important Topics: Owing to the scarcity of time, you must focus on the most important topics. Take Online Mock Tests: This is the key to success in the NEET exam. You must attempt online tests on a regular basis. This will help you evaluate your current preparation level and help you identify the areas where you need improvement.

First and foremost is that don't take too much pressure .Ride it as normal as you can. "NCERT and previous year question papers is the key to success in NEET." "90% Questions asked in NEET are from NCERT textbooks & NCERT Exemplars." "10% Questions asked in NEET are from OTHER books." Physics Important topics: Optics, Mechanics, Nuclear Physics, Thermodynamics, Electrodynamics, Atomic & Molecular Physics, kinematics, laws of motion, electrostatics, and magnetic effects of current and modern physics. "15% Questions asked in NEET are Theory based." "85% Questions asked in NEET are Numericals." The following chapters constitute 25% of the total questions in Physics:- Units and Measurements, Motion in a straight line and in a plane, Work, Energy & power, System of particles and rotational motion, Gravitation, Fluid statics. The following chapters constitute 30% of the total questions:- Waves and oscillations, Electric charges and field, Electrostatic potential and capacitance, current electricity The following chapters constitute 20% of the total questions:- Dual Nature of matter, Atoms and nuclei, Semiconductor electronics, Thermodynamics Chemistry Important topics: General Organic Chemistry, Mole Concept, Periodic Table, Coordination Chemistry, Chemical Bonding. Physical Chemistry: "10% Questions asked in NEET are Theory based." "90% Questions asked in NEET are Numericals." Organic chemistry "First solve Numerical from NCERT then read Theory." Inorganic chemistry: "30% Questions asked in NEET are Theory based." "70% Questions asked in NEET are Numericals." Class XI physical chemistry chapters constitute 25% of the total questions (such as basic concepts of chemistry, States of matter etc) Class XII physical chemistry chapters constitute 15% of the total questions (such as Redox reactions, Solid state, solutions etc) Class XI Organic chemistry chapters constitute 5% of the total questions (such as Hydrocarbons, Environmental Chemistry etc) Class XII Organic chemistry chapters constitute 25% of total questions (such as Haloalkanes and haloarenes, Biomolecules etc) Class XI inorganic chemistry constitutes 10% of total questions (such as Hydrogen, s-block elements etc) Class XII inorganic chemistry constitutes 20% of the total questions (such as Metallurgy, d & f - block elements etc) Biology Important topics: Ecology & Environment, Cell Biology, Morphology of plants and animals, Reproduction, Physiology of Animals & Plants. The following chapters constitute 25% of total questions. Living World, Biological classification, Plant Kingdom, Morphology of plants, Anatomy of plants The following chapters constitute 30% of total questions Transport in Plants, Mineral Nutrition, Photosynthesis, Respiration, Plant Growth and Development, Digestion, Respiration, Body fluids and Circulation, Excretion, Locomotion and movement, and Nervous system and the Endocrine system Ecology constitutes about 10% of the total questions. The remaining questions from genetics, Biotechnology etc will be fairly easy. Physics:  HC Verma Cengege Physics series of 5–6 books for Jee advanced by BM Sharma. Collection of Questions & Problems in Physics by L.A. Sena  Chemistry: Modern Approach to Chemical Calculations – R.C. Mukherjee Balaji Advanced problems in P.C.(Narendra Awasthi). Balaji Advanced problems in I.C.(Vinod Kumar Jaiswal). Balaji Advanced problems in O.C.(M.S.Chouhan). Objective Biology by MTG Revision DPP & Test Series by Resonance & FIITJEE.

Well it isn’t much difficult I say! You may think I’m kidding, but gotta believe this moron after you analyse a bunch of scribbling I’m about to do… firstly, I had appeared last year, but didn't qualify with flying colors and so gonna sit this time again.. and if any brain has to say why to believe a guy who couldn’t qualify himself, Huh.. you have a good argument man! there’s no failure, rather more experience and maturity! and one most important one, For NEET exam, there are few things that are equally important just like the ingredients of Tea.. if even one is missing you wont have something called Tea, similarly, patience, hardwork, knowledge, being away from distractions, memorising and confidence are important EQUALLY for qualifying NEET. To be honest, you don’t need to read all these with popped up eyes or an open mouth as if some kinds of secrets im here to reveal, but its just simple analysis which most of time we do without using our cerebrum! So, for inorganic chemistry, certain portion are pure memory based, have them listed down to mug up doing daily chores. It requires question solving, since this will give you the idea of how question is derived. Read the chapter notes thoroughly once a week. for organic chemistry, analyse different segments it has; don't be depressed by the storm of reactions, because there isn't any such thing so! Yeah! Let me clarify it: the total reactions are just a quarter of what you see! Coz preparation reaction of alochol from caroboxylic acid is nothing but the chemical reaction of carboxylic acid! So this way, reactions are simply repeated frequently! Also, to be able to do questions better, catch the concepts. Eg. Grignard reagents give alkyl group but with -ve sign, i.e nucleophile. This will make solving questions easier. So have a list of reagents & their way of acting. memorise physical chemistry and physics formulae and know the chp concepts. This requires nothing but practicing! Biology is all time job. Requires NCERT reading as a must plus question practice. What are you doing? Studying physics or chemistry? No Eating, sleeping, refreshing or any urgent work? No That means you are studying biology! will i be able to finish ALL the chps and will i be able to retain them?? never think about this at this high time… well the answer is NO, neither will you finish them all, nor will you remember them.. satisfied?! Dear, the truth is.. it doesn’t matter.. but what matters is.. has these thoughts put a full stop to your studies or you still continue? coz if you do, Insha Allah you’ll see victory either today or tomorrow.. but if this thinking is enough to stop you, there’s a sure stamped failure destined! as it isn’t just you on this planet who has this feeling, its millions out there freaking with the same issue.. wanna join them or shine out of them is what you decide today! best of luck ;)

Solve the papers….. Paper solving is the most crucial part of any entrance exam preparation whether you are preparing for medical entrance exam , engineering entrance exam or any civil services exam . If you have avoided paper solving you won't be able to score best according to your knowledge . Let's take a basic example that you are preparing for marathon for that you need extreme amount of energy and stamina . Energy can be stored through food consumption but for stamina you must run and practice for the same distance. Reading is like eating but solving papers on regular basis builds your stamina . So whether you are preparing for medical , engineering or any civil entrance exam , you must solve the previous years paper on regular basis to develop similar level of mental stamina to perform exceptionally well in entrance exam. Here are the few benefits of solving previous years papers on regular basis 1) Solving a complete 3 hours paper build your mental stamina for the main exam. 2) If you are a dropper student or reattempting any exam , solving paper help you to revise complete syllabus as most of the competition exams cover whole syllabus through a paper 3) Solving a 3 hour paper on regular basis enables you to improve your study hours and stamina for main exam 4) solving papers on regular basis decrease chances of silly mistakes in main exam , silly mistakes can be improved through regular practice only , most of the students who create silly mistakes in paper are who those don't solve enough papers during their preparation journey 5) solving papers make easier for you to find out your weakness , if you are struggling on same chapter's question again and again then you must revise and learn that topic again 6) Most of the Pre-medical aspirants are comfortable with biology but not with chemistry and physics so they feel little awkward to solve full syllabus paper . Even in this case you must solve biology full syllabus Paper but in case of chemistry and physics you can go through chapter wise previous year papers. 7) Having vast experience in teaching to premedical aspirants , i feel that most of the pmt aspirants should solve previous years papers of Kerala PMT , Karnataka CET , AIPMT , JEE mains and AIIMS . These exams contains most of the conceptual problems which are NCERT based too Thank you

**Below are a few tips provided on how to crack NEET** Download past few years' papers of AIPMT and see the pattern. By now you must be aware of the concepts and now need to focus on practicing the problems (like conceptual/numerical questions in Physics). For Biology and Chemistry, read from NCERT books Join a crash course (if possible), where you will learn about the important NEET topics and you can clear your doubts using a professional help For those studying on their own, in last couple of weeks before the exam, focus on revision As the exam is more Biology centric, you must allot at least 2 weeks to it for proper revision and one week each for Physics and Chemistry While you prepare, create notes formula sheet for Physics, footnotes carrying important keywords for Biology and equations sheet for Chemistry, you can then solve papers and mock test in the remaining days of your revision. Mock test will help you assess the level of your preparation and will give you a better understanding the exam In the end, just go through all the key words you've noted previously so as to revise every concept as quickly as possible. Remember keep the last day of preparation light yet productive. **The important chapters of each subject ** **Physics: **Oscillations and Waves, Magnetic Effect of Current and Magnetism, Kinematics, Heat and Thermodynamics, Electrostatics and Current Electricity. **Chemistry: **Organic Chemistry (IUPAC nomenclature is a key type of question), Chemical Bonding and Molecular Structure, Coordination Compounds, p-block elements, Equilibrium, Biomolecules, Aldehydes Ketones Carboxylic Acids, Alcohol Phenol Ether and Chemical Kinetics. **Biology: **The Living World, Biological Classification, Chemical Control and Integration, Principles of Inheritance And Variation, Molecular Basis of Inheritance, Cell and Sexual Reproduction in Flowering Plants. It's simple actually. Solve as many test series as you can. Attend discussions after test series. Every question has four answers but only one correct answer. Try to figure out why the other three answers are wrong and to what questions those answers could be the right choice. If each question paper has 100 questions, it will have 300 more of potential questions. Hence, solving 4 question papers is equivalent to 4*100*400 = 16000 questions everyday! Remember, never underestimate the power of hard work and never overestimate talent. Also, side by side, try solving at least 4 mock or previous year question papers everyday. Limit your sleep to 6hrs per day. Eat healthy but limited. Work hard, but smartly. Best of luck! PS: I'm presuming that you have read through the syllabus and are thorough with the “basic” concepts of the syllabus.

There are several approaches for adopting a study method for NEET preparation. Primarily you need to be thorough with your 12th standard Physics, Chemistry and Biology concepts. Apart from this there are textbooks that comes with MCQs that are asked in actual NEET exam. However, I would like to recommend one more approach. There is a new App in the market, where you can register and take NEET challenges. NEET challenges in this App are timed NEET exams, which are taken by many Students on the same day and at the same time. So, you will be getting the feel of a real NEET exam when you take these NEET challenges. The best part is once you submit the exam, will come to know your score within a short period of time after you submit your NEET challenge, you can also gauge yourself and you can also gauge where you stand in the competition among your peers.

You can follow below strategies to crack your Neet Exam with good rank- Prepare a Preparation Schedule: You must assign a fixed amount of time to a fixed number of chapters and complete the chapters as per the designed schedule.Review & Solve Previous Years’ Papers: This is the best way to boost up your preparation owing to the scarcity of time.Study the Right Material: You must refer to NCERT books for all the three subjects. You must also refer to additional comprehensive books for practising MCQs.Build Your Concepts : You must develop a strong base in all the three subjects and must clear your concepts. This would greatly help you in solving conceptual questions.Practice: You must practice a mixed bag of MCQs from different comprehensive books and from different Internet sources.Focus On Important Topics: Owing to the scarcity of time, you must focus on the most important topics.Hope this helps!!!
